description: Breakthrough Functional Medicine | 68 followers on LinkedIn. To provide treatment options for root causes of illness, by bringing the body into balance with healing & hope. | Our mission is to deliver a systematic approach to wellness that identifies the root cause of illness and provide treatment options for bringing the body into balance with healing and hope. We work with you to help uncover the underlying causes of low energy, autoimmune diseases, hormone imbalance, and gut dysfunction.
cleaned_text: [](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mackenzie-jones-8a25a6a0?trk=organization_guest_main-feed-card_reshare_feed-actor-image) Owner of Breakthrough Functional Medicine & Family Nurse Practitioner Elevate Your Brain Health: Unveiling Three Powerful Supplements! Did you know that nurturing your brain health is essential for a vibrant and fulfilling life? Let's dive into three brain-boosting supplements that can support your cognitive function and memory: 1 High DHA Fish Oil: Omega-3 fatty acids, particularly DHA found in fish oil, are like nourishment for your brain. They promote healthy brain structure, reduce inflammation, and support memory and learning abilities. 2 Bacopa Monnieri: This herb has been used for centuries in traditional medicine to support brain function. Studies suggest it might enhance memory, attention, and overall cognitive performance. 3 B-12: This vital vitamin plays a crucial role in maintaining healthy nerve cells and aiding in the production of neurotransmitters. It's an energy booster for your brain cells and may contribute to improved memory and focus. Are you intrigued to take your brain health to the next level? Check out our 90-Minute Foundational Health Assessment, where we dive deep into your brain health, discuss essential labs, and explore the potential benefits of these brain-boosting supplements. Early onset memory loss and dementia are challenges we can address proactively. Let's empower you with the knowledge and tools to nurture your brain health for a thriving future.
